definitions.sensetop: die of/from somethingdie with somethingdie for somethingdie a… deathdie + adj.die + noun

examples.text: My father **died suddenly** at the age of 48.
At least six people have died in the accident.
That plant's going to die if you don't water it!
He later died in hospital.
They died fighting for their country.
She died peacefully after a long illness.
to die with dignity
to die of/from cancer *(= cancer is the cause of death)*
A further 156 people have died with Covid-19 *(= they had the disease when they died)*.
He was ready to die for his cause.
I'll never forget it **to my dying day** *(= until I die)*.
**I nearly died** when I saw him there *(= it was very embarrassing)*.
to die a natural/slow/horrible/violent death
She died young.
At least they died happy.
He died a hero.
He died a poor man.
Her husband died suddenly last week.
That plant's died.
He died for his beliefs.
Her father died tragically in a car crash.
30 000 people died as a result of the earthquake.
A dog lay dying in the road.
I nearly died when they told me the price.
I thought I was going to die.
One of their children died in infancy.
She should be allowed to die peacefully.
The accident victim died from her injuries.
to die for your country
Her father died of cancer.
I'm not afraid to die.
She died a natural death.

phrases: die a natural, violent, etc. death

examples.text: The old customs are dying.
His secret died with him *(= he never told anyone)*.
The words died on my lips *(= I stopped speaking)*.
My phone died and I had no way to contact you.
The engine spluttered and died.
My car just **died on me**.

definitions.definition: to want something or want to do something very much

examples.text: I'm dying for a glass of water.
I'm dying to know what happened.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize that you are telling the truth or will do what you promise

examples.text: I saw him do it—cross my heart.
The play got terrible reviews and quickly died a death.

definitions.definition: to die because you are old or ill

examples.text: I nearly died laughing when she said that.

definitions.definition: to die or become ill and fall down in very large numbers

examples.text: People were dropping like flies in the intense heat.

definitions.definition: a situation where you need to act in a very determined way or taking a great risk, because there is no alternative

examples.text: At this stage in the competition it's do or die.

definitions.definition: used to say that things change very slowly
if you think something is to die for, you really want it, and would do anything to get it

examples.text: She was wearing a dress to die for.

wordOrigin: verb Middle English: from Old Norse deyja, of Germanic origin; related to dead.
